hero.title: Historical Simulation Under Defined Parameters.
hero.subtitle: The following results reflect rule-based historical backtesting conducted within the TradingView Strategy Tester environment.
overview.title: Overview
overview.desc: The performance data presented below is derived from systematic backtesting using predefined strategy rules. The objective of this section is to illustrate how the strategy would have behaved under historical market conditions, given specific execution and cost assumptions.
metrics.title: Key Metrics
metrics.subtitle: Core statistical indicators derived from historical simulation.

metrics.items.title: Net Return
metrics.items.description: Total percentage return generated during the selected backtest period.

metrics.items.title: Max Drawdown
metrics.items.description: Largest peak-to-trough equity decline observed during the simulation.

metrics.items.title: Profit Factor
metrics.items.description: Gross profit divided by gross loss across all simulated trades.

metrics.items.title: Win Rate
metrics.items.description: Percentage of trades closed in profit.

metrics.items.title: Total Trades
metrics.items.description: Number of executed trades within the backtest period.

limitations.title: Limitations of Backtesting
limitations.desc: Backtesting is a method of evaluating a strategy using historical data. Simulated results have inherent limitations and do not reflect real-time market conditions, liquidity constraints, order book dynamics, latency, funding rates, psychological decision-making, or structural market changes.
methodology.title: Backtesting Methodology & Execution Assumptions
methodology.subtitle: Key assumptions and setup used to simulate historical trades, including data, execution, and cost parameters.

methodology.items.title: Platform Environment
methodology.items.description: All simulations were conducted using the TradingView Strategy Tester.

methodology.items.title: Data Basis
methodology.items.description: Historical price data provided by TradingView was used for testing. Data accuracy depends on the data feed available at the time of analysis.

methodology.items.title: Commission Model
methodology.items.description: A commission rate of 0.6% per trade was applied, reflecting publicly documented Bitget fee structures at the time of testing.

methodology.items.title: Slippage Assumption
methodology.items.description: A slippage parameter of 2 was applied within TradingView to simulate execution friction.

methodology.items.title: Execution Logic
methodology.items.description: Trade entries are executed when strategy conditions are met without bar-close delay. Position closures are confirmed at bar close.

methodology.items.title: Intrabar Simulation
methodology.items.description: Intrabar execution is modeled according to TradingViewâ€™s internal engine and does not represent true tick-level market execution.

methodology.items.title: Indicator Integrity
methodology.items.description: No repainting indicators are used. All signals are generated from non-forward-looking data.
